# init(code:userActivity:)

**Initializer**

Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Declaration

```swift
init(code: INPauseWorkoutIntentResponseCode, userActivity: NSUserActivity?)
```

## Parameters

- **code**: The response code that indicates your success or failure when handling the intent. For a list of possible codes, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPauseWorkoutIntentResponseCode].
- **userActivity**: The user activity object to use when launching your app. Provide an object if you want to add information specific to your app. If you specify `nil`, the system automatically creates a user activity object for you, sets its type to the class name of the intent being handled, and fills it with an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INInteraction] object containing the intent and your response.

## Return Value

An initialized response object or `nil` if the object could not be created.
title: init(code:userActivity:)
